Simulate draws from a beta-binomial distribution

rbetabinom.Rd

Simulate draws from a beta-binomial distribution

Usage

rbetabinom(n, size, prob, phi)

Arguments

n

Integer value: number of samples to draw.

size

Integer value: number of trials for each sample.

prob

Vector, matrix, or array of real values specifying the probability of success.

phi

Real value: "over/under- dispersion parameter" for beta-binomial likelihood. In this parameterization, the latent beta variable has shape \(\mu\phi\) and scale \((1-\mu)\phi\), where \(\mu\) is the probability of success in the binomial distribution.

Value

A vector of draws from the specified beta-binomial distribution.

Examples


bbdraws <- rbetabinom(n=100, size=10, prob=0.3, phi=2)
